result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Cain Borrego-Arroyo

records.addlTxt: nationwide. Signed by SRN on 09/02/22. arc   c: SCSO with complaint  e: DA

9:17 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Eric Cain Borrego-Arroyo not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Monica Marin here in person.  DE not in court, hall called.  Court issues WARRANT, Extradite Nationwide. bph

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Angela B. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Not to use or possess firearms.  If Defendant owns any firearms they are to be surrendered within 24 hours after released from custody.  

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:10 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Eric Cain Borrego-Arroyo in court, in custody.  Monica Marin appears by video.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad with intern Alison Casey in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Eric Cain Borrego-Arroyo. Interpreter sworn. DE confirms address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. DE waives speedy PH.  DE does not qualify for PD. PFAC given to DE, Court will attempt to appoint Atty Perrin.  Adjourned at 1:25 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Settlement conference on August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:06 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Michelle Brekken with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson for today. Court has been advised that DE will require a spanish interpreter. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Court adjourns INIT and finds good cause to not set bond at this time. Adjourned at 1:10 PM.  gll
Initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
